page.title: 08Housing in S. Cambridge (2)
page.content: Roman Catholic church with its tall spire,built in 1885 with funds from a French lady Mrs Lyne-Stephens who was the most famous Victorian ballet dancer in London. It has services in several languages including Polish and Italian. Many changes have taken place in Newtown in the last 20 years -slum housing has been pulled down and re- placed by a car park and council flats small shops and several pubs have dis- appeared-large Victorian houses have become flats and language schools. Newnham village expanded in Victorian and Edwardian times to become part of Cambridge. There are small shops and a school, a Victorian church,and houses often occupied by university families. Newnham college- one of 2 colleges for women dates from 1875. The old village atmosphere can be captured in the old pubs by the Mill pool and Malting Lane
